field.value:
Quoting Matt Berther <matt.berther@gmail.com>:
"Looking at ServerUtilityAdapter (http://svn.castleproject.org/svn/castle/trunk/MonoRail/Castle.MonoRail.Engine/Adapters/ServerUtilityAdapter.cs), it simply delegates to HttpUtility.UrlEncode.
UrlEncode does not handle the javascript properly. What I had to do (temporarily) is:
HttpUtility.UrlEncode(input).Replace("'", @"\'");
This handles both situations... UrlEncode handles the + situation, and .Replace("'", @"\'") handles the ' situation."
